channel.title: Windows Ad Edition could be free!
channel.description:
[b]A free, ad-based version of Windows may already be in the making., if not completed. [/b] ZoomTalk of a free edition of Microsoft's Windows OS isn't anything new: the idea has been around since 2005 at the very least. However, Stephen Chapman of MSFTKitchen seems the think the free edition is closer to reality than ever before, especially with businesses pushing to move software into the cloud. After a little digging, he discovered that an actual ad-based version of Windows has actually been created.
sause: http://www.tomshardware.co.uk/Windows-Advertising-OS-Free-Piracy,news-33156.html I think it's interesting how a company like Microsoft will actually release such a thing but obviously there are strings attached meaning it will a fucking pain in the ass to use. This just looks like a desperate attempt to prevent piracy; It wont be stopping me, that's for sure. disscuss.

item.title: Windows Ad Edition could be free!
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:26, topic:335924”][quote author=BAsh link=topic=432305.msg3180227#msg3180227 date=1271238870]

That’s the most ridiculous thing I’ve ever heard. Who wants advertising in their operating system?

someone who does not want to dish out $99 for their operating system

They would just use a better, free OS, like linux.

Or a better idea: Bundle linux with free Windows in a Virtual Machine. Fast, secure and when you actually have to use Windows: fire up the VM automagically. Of course you wound need access to underlying 3D hardware for games but I think VMWare already has that feature. You would have a choice between openoffice or ad-infested office (they’re not going to stop at just Windows).
[/quote]

I’m sure they would have some sort of restriction on distribution disallowing that. Also I don’t know if VMware has hardware acceleration, but VirtualBox does.[/quote]
vmware has hardware acceleration. its been there long before virtualbox got it

Read full topic
item.source: Windows Ad Edition could be free!

You would have a choice between openoffice or ad-infested office (they’re not going to stop at just Windows).[/quote]

item.title: Windows Ad Edition could be free!
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

A while ago I received an offer that allowed me to print for free, but only single sided. A fair deal I thought, but the reason it was single sided was that the other side would be full of adverts. So I’d end up handing in papers consisting of 50% ads. That ought to get my grades up…

You try to get rid of all the ads while browsing, why would you use an OS that’s riddled with ads while there are free alternatives?

Read full topic
